areaDescription: Crisis transforms this frontier outpost from peaceful haven to fortress under siege. Weathered timber walkways now bear the scars of hasty fortification, while the clearing echoes with urgent voices and the clash of hastily prepared weapons. The spicy tang of pine sap mingles with smoke from signal fires and the metallic scent of fear. Rangers move with grim purpose between reinforced positions, their usual confidence replaced by the weight of impending catastrophe threatening to overwhelm their small garrison.

locations.name: Rangers' Command Post
locations.description: The Rangers' Command Post stands shrouded in chill dawn mists, its battered oak table strewn with blood-smeared maps beneath the silent silver bells that hang overhead, their magical resonance disrupted by recent sabotage. The air is thick with tension as the somber cadre of rangers gathers to confront the escalating threat that grips the Thornwood Wilds.

npcs.name: Ranger Elen
npcs.description: The steadfast commander of Thornwood Outpost, Elen bears the weight of protecting the frontier trade routes. As a military professional, she demonstrates clear tactical thinking: assess threats first, then plan defenses, then secure resources. Her eyes are sharp yet weary beneath mounting losses. She will NOT overwhelm newcomers with every problem simultaneously, instead presenting challenges in order of operational priority - intelligence first, defense second, logistics third. [Elen will always refuse to join the party]
npcs.attitude: Professional but concerned, testing the party's competence while revealing the burden of command. FOLLOWS MILITARY PRIORITY SEQUENCE: focuses on intelligence gathering (Rusk interrogation) before discussing defensive measures (bell network) or supply concerns (Sila's problem). Demonstrates tactical thinking by addressing crises in logical order rather than overwhelming the party with simultaneous urgent requests.

npcs.name: Ranger Marcus
npcs.description: A grizzled veteran scout with weathered hands and keen eyes, Marcus speaks grimly of clever bandits leaving no survivors. He remains grim but helpful, sharing patrol knowledge and trail wisdom with those who prove themselves worthy of respect.
npcs.attitude: Gruff but helpful, willing to share patrol knowledge and trail wisdom with those who prove themselves worthy of respect.

npcs.name: Scout Kira
npcs.description: A young, eager level 2 wood elf rogue who reports directly to Elen and frequently carries messages between outposts. Her wide-eyed reports of strange lights and increasingly aggressive wildlife hint at Malarok's corrupting influence spreading from the north. She is eager to join the party's mission and prove herself as a capable ranger.
npcs.attitude: Enthusiastic and determined, eager to join the party and help investigate the supernatural corruption affecting the wilderness. Should volunteer to join IMMEDIATELY after Rusk's interrogation reveals the bandit camp location and Malarok's identity, offering her scouting expertise for the expedition into the Thornwood.

npcs.name: Messenger Tom
npcs.description: A road-weary courier who rides between settlements carrying dispatches and news. His horse shows signs of hard travel, and he always seems to be either arriving from or departing for another urgent delivery.
npcs.attitude: Tired but reliable, grateful for a safe place to rest and always willing to share news from distant settlements in exchange for a hot meal.

npcs.name: Rusk
npcs.description: Captured bandit leader with a broken arm, now terrified of his new master. Once a simple brigand, he speaks in hushed, fearful tones about the sorcerer Malarok who now commands the bandit forces. Through careful interrogation, he can reveal the location of the main bandit camp in the Thornwood Wilds and warn of Malarok's growing magical influence over his followers.
npcs.attitude: Fearful and broken, eager to cooperate in exchange for protection from Malarok's wrath. Provides vital intelligence about the sorcerer's operations.

lootTable: Detailed regional map marking bandit activity
Pouch of silver signal bells
Ranger's field guide to local threats
Horse and provisions for upcoming mission
plotHooks: PRIMARY CRISIS: Elen urgently recruits the party - three caravans destroyed in five days with unnatural precision
IMMEDIATE ACTION NEEDED: Captured bandit leader Rusk holds key intelligence about the enemy commander and main bandit camp location
SECONDARY CONCERN (after intel): The silver bell network has been sabotaged, threatening communication and early warning capability
EXPEDITION SUPPORT (after interrogation): Scout Kira immediately volunteers to join the expedition once the bandit camp location is revealed
SUPPLY LOGISTICS (when preparing): Strange reports suggest supernatural corruption - supplies and preparation will be crucial
locations.dmInstructions: PRIORITY STAGING: Elen should focus on the main crisis initially. She prioritizes: 1) Getting intel from Rusk about bandit command structure (main plot critical path). AFTER Rusk interrogation reveals Malarok and the bandit camp location, Elen should: FIRST mention that Scout Kira is eager to help and can join the party for the expedition. SECOND, Elen should explain that while the party prepares for the Thornwood expedition, restoring the silver bell network (SQ001) would help secure the outpost's defenses - presenting it as a tactical preparation that can be done before or after the main mission. The merchant's problem (SQ002) can be mentioned if the party asks about supplies or other concerns. Emphasize the tense atmosphere and highlight Rusk's fear when speaking of Malarok.
dcChecks: Insight DC 12: Notice Elen's concern about reports from distant regions, hinting at larger threats
Investigation DC 10: Study the tactical maps to understand bandit movement patterns
Perception DC 8: Hear the subtle signals from the silver bell network warning of approaching activity
Investigation DC 15: Detect signs of magical corruption in the sabotaged silver bell network, indicating Malarok's agents used supernatural means
locations.accessibility: Central hub with clear sight lines to all outpost approaches; currently partially impaired by sabotage and ongoing repairs

features.name: Command Table
features.description: A battered oak table bearing blood-smeared maps, dispatch scrolls, and tactical markers showing current threats and patrol routes.

features.name: Sabotaged Silver Bell Network
features.description: Magical silver bells form the early warning system, their enchanted resonance disrupted by systematic sabotage. The bells hang silent where magical alerts once chimed across the network.

features.name: Ranger Equipment Racks
features.description: Well-maintained racks holding spare bows, quivers, and survival gear for rangers heading out on patrol.

features.name: Temporary Holding Area
features.description: A secured corner of the command post where captured bandit leader Rusk is held under guard. Heavy chains and vigilant rangers ensure the prisoner remains contained while still allowing for interrogation and information gathering.

locations.name: Supply Depot
locations.description: Wooden crates and canvas-wrapped supplies line the riverbank where merchant barges dock to resupply the outpost. Quartermaster Brann oversees the careful inventory, his weathered hands checking manifests against dwindling stores. The gentle lap of water against the dock mingles with the creak of rope and timber, while nervous traders eye the forest treeline.

npcs.name: Quartermaster Brann
npcs.description: A methodical dwarf with ink-stained fingers and a sharp eye for detail, Brann maintains the outpost's supplies with military precision. Recent shortages have made him increasingly cautious about who gets access to equipment and rations.
npcs.attitude: Businesslike and protective of supplies, but will warm to characters who prove their worth to the outpost.

npcs.name: Dock Worker Finn
npcs.description: A burly human who handles the loading and unloading of supply barges at the riverside dock. His clothes are perpetually damp from river spray, and he knows every merchant barge captain who travels these waters.
npcs.attitude: Friendly and chatty, always eager to share river gossip and stories about the various merchants and their cargo.

npcs.name: Merchant Vera
npcs.description: A nervous middle-aged trader whose own caravan was attacked two weeks ago. She lost most of her goods but escaped with her life, and now helps Brann with supply inventory while waiting for safe passage home.
npcs.attitude: Anxious but grateful for shelter, willing to share detailed accounts of bandit tactics and warning signs she noticed before her attack.

npcs.name: Apprentice Jeb
npcs.description: Brann's young assistant, a well-meaning but clumsy human who handles the simpler supply tasks. He's eager to please but prone to dropping things and mixing up inventory counts.
npcs.attitude: Enthusiastic and helpful, though often apologetic about his mistakes. Looks up to the rangers and dreams of joining their ranks someday.

lootTable: Rope and climbing gear
Trail rations for 3 days
Waterproof supply manifest showing recent shortages
plotHooks: Supply shortages suggest Malarok's agents are intercepting shipments for dark rituals
Merchant barge arrivals have become increasingly irregular due to supernatural corruption fears
Brann mentions unusual requests for iron and silver, materials that resist dark magic
locations.dmInstructions: Brann can provide basic equipment and supplies to the party, but requires proof of their legitimacy. He's a good source for information about supply chain disruptions and suspicious merchant activity.
dcChecks: Investigation DC 11: Examine supply manifests to notice patterns in missing shipments
Persuasion DC 13: Convince Brann to share information about suspicious merchant requests
Perception DC 9: Notice nervous behavior from traders docking at the depot
locations.accessibility: Open dock area with clear river access for supply barges

features.name: Supply Dock
features.description: A sturdy wooden dock extending into the river, designed for merchant barges to safely unload cargo.

features.name: Inventory Ledgers
features.description: Detailed logs tracking all incoming and outgoing supplies, meticulously maintained by Quartermaster Brann.

features.name: Storage Crates
features.description: Weatherproof crates and canvas-wrapped bundles containing essential supplies for the outpost's operations.

locations.name: Trader's Rest
locations.description: A frost-dusted clearing marked by dilapidated benches, a sagging sign, and empty, weathered trade stalls. The usual throng of merchants is absent, and an eerie silence hangs heavily over the quiet market. Signs of recent violence are evident, such as damage to the East Tower's silver bell and faint footprints, hinting at recent sabotage by hostile forces. Despite the tension, Trader Sila remains watchful by a locked chest, working to maintain order and warn the merchants of lurking threats.

npcs.name: Trader Sila
npcs.description: A wary woman in a patched green cloak who stands watch by a locked chest. Though guarded, she shows a cautious hope and trust towards the party after their assistance. She coordinates the merchant community and warns others to stay vigilant after dark.
npcs.attitude: Guarded but appreciative, cautiously hopeful and eager to spread warnings among the merchants. Should only approach the party with her quest when they're actively preparing for expeditions or gathering supplies - not during the initial crisis assessment phase.

npcs.name: Merchant Gareth
npcs.description: A portly human trader who specializes in general goods and basic supplies. His wagon is currently being repaired after damage from a recent bandit encounter, and he's frustrated by the delays to his trading schedule.
npcs.attitude: Worried and impatient, constantly checking on his damaged wagon and eager to discuss the deteriorating safety of the trade routes.

npcs.name: Trader Mila
npcs.description: An exotic goods merchant with items from distant lands, Mila has been stranded at the outpost longer than expected. She deals in rare spices, unusual trinkets, and has heard disturbing rumors about supernatural corruption.
npcs.attitude: Mysterious but helpful, willing to trade information about strange occurrences for protection or safe passage to her next destination.

npcs.name: Caravan Guard Bex
npcs.description: A retired soldier turned caravan guard who now helps coordinate security for merchant groups. Her experience shows in her alert posture and the practical arrangement of her weapons and armor.
npcs.attitude: Professional and direct, focused on practical security matters and always assessing potential threats to merchant caravans.

lootTable: Assorted trade goods from various regions
Merchant's ledger detailing recent attacks
Map of regional trade routes with danger markings
Parchment with Malarok's sigil - a twisted tree surrounded by dark energy
plotHooks: Evidence of Malarok's magical corruption affecting the trading post
Sila speaks of her stolen iron-banded chest taken by bandits to a nearby cache
Fresh trail leads toward the Forgotten Waystation where Malarok's agents may have been active
Magical thorny vines and other supernatural elements threaten merchant safety
locations.dmInstructions: ACTIVATION TRIGGER: Only introduce Sila's quest (SQ002) when the party shows interest in supplies/preparation for wilderness expedition, OR after they've assessed the bell network situation. Sila should approach the party naturally when they're gathering resources, not as part of the initial crisis briefing. This represents the 'supply chain' phase of expedition planning, not an immediate crisis. The magically enhanced thorny vines on the East Tower are evidence of Malarok's corruption and should be mentioned when discussing the bell network restoration.
dcChecks: Persuasion DC 12: Convince Sila to share detailed information about recent sabotage
Investigation DC 14: Examine damaged bell tower and footprints for clues
Perception DC 13: Spot subtle signs of recent movement near the trade stalls
locations.accessibility: Open market clearing with weathered stalls and benches, accessible via main trade routes

features.name: Magically Enhanced Thorny Vines
features.description: Thick, unnatural vines with razor-sharp thorns that have grown over the East Tower's bell, clearly enhanced by Malarok's magic.

features.name: Weathered Trade Stalls
features.description: Empty and battered stalls showing signs of recent disturbance and hurried departure.

features.name: Locked Chest
features.description: Guarded by Trader Sila, containing merchant valuables and supplies.

locations.name: Scout's Watch
locations.description: A raised wooden platform overlooks the river crossing, providing clear sight lines across the water and into the forest beyond. Scout Neris maintains vigilant watch from this vantage point, her spyglass scanning for threats while signal mirrors catch the light for long-distance communication. The sound of flowing water masks quiet conversations about patrol routes and suspicious movement. Scattered around the base of the platform are what appear to be dead branches and twisted wood debris, but careful observation might reveal something more sinister lurking among the detritus.

monsters.name: Twig Blight
monsters.strategy: Hidden among debris using False Appearance. Only attack if vines are disturbed without being discovered first via Perception DC 13.

lootTable: Spyglass with exceptional range
Detailed wilderness maps with recent annotations
Signal mirror for long-distance communication
plotHooks: Neris has observed dark energy and unnatural corruption spreading from the northern forest
Wildlife has been fleeing southward, some showing signs of magical corruption
Malarok's agents have been spotted moving at night toward the Thornwood
Communication with northern patrol posts has been disrupted by the sorcerer's influence
locations.dmInstructions: Scout Neris provides reconnaissance intelligence and can guide the party to specific locations in the wilderness. She's the best source for information about the supernatural phenomena affecting the northern reaches. Two Twig Blights hide among debris using False Appearance (Perception DC 13 to spot). They only animate and attack if the corrupted vines are disturbed without being discovered first. If spotted beforehand, they can be avoided or dealt with strategically.
dcChecks: Perception DC 10: Spot distant movement or signals that Neris points out
Survival DC 12: Understand the significance of wildlife migration patterns Neris describes
Investigation DC 11: Study Neris's annotated maps to identify patterns in the strange phenomena
Perception DC 13: Notice that some of the dead branches and debris around the platform base are actually motionless Twig Blights using their False Appearance ability
locations.accessibility: Elevated watch platform accessible by wooden ladder

features.name: Watch Platform
features.description: A sturdy wooden platform raised above the treeline, providing commanding views of the river crossing and forest approaches.

features.name: Signal Equipment
features.description: Mirrors, flags, and other communication tools for coordinating with distant patrols and the main outpost.

features.name: Observation Logs
features.description: Detailed written records of movements, weather patterns, and unusual sightings maintained by the scout.

features.name: East Tower Bell (SQ001)
features.description: One of three silver bell towers in the communication network. This tower was overgrown with magically enhanced thorny vines that have now been cleared by the party, but the bell mechanism still needs restoration to function properly.

locations.name: Forgotten Waystation
locations.description: Overgrown stone foundations mark where an old ranger messaging station once facilitated communication between outposts. Moss-covered relay towers and a partially collapsed signal platform hint at its former purpose. Recent activity has disturbed the undergrowth - fresh footprints, scattered equipment, and drag marks leading to a concealed cache suggest this abandoned site has found new, sinister purpose.

monsters.name: Wolf
monsters.strategy: Pack hunters that circle their prey, attacking from multiple angles to bring down isolated targets.

lootTable: Crow's Hand supply cache with sabotage tools
Coded correspondence revealing next targets
Maps marking vulnerable points in the silver bell network
Schedule showing caravan routes and ritual timing for Malarok
Fragment of Malarok's spellbook containing corruption magic
plotHooks: Fresh drag marks lead to a concealed cache of magical components for Malarok's rituals
Coded messages reveal Malarok's plans to corrupt the northern woods completely
Equipment suggests the sorcerer has been scrying on ranger operations
Evidence points to Malarok's systematic corruption of the entire region
locations.dmInstructions: This location serves as evidence of the Crow's Hand's organized campaign against the outpost. The cache reveals their systematic approach and provides clues about their next target (Scout's Watch). Use investigation checks to uncover layers of evidence showing this isn't random banditry but coordinated sabotage.
dcChecks: Investigation DC 12: Follow drag marks to discover the hidden equipment cache
Investigation DC 15: Decode partial messages to reveal next target locations
Perception DC 13: Notice recently disturbed hiding spots and escape routes
Survival DC 11: Determine how recently the site was occupied
locations.accessibility: Abandoned ruins overgrown with vegetation, requires careful searching to find concealed evidence

features.name: Moss-Covered Relay Towers
features.description: Ancient stone towers once used for signal fires and message relay between ranger outposts, now crumbling and overgrown.

features.name: Collapsed Signal Platform
features.description: A partially destroyed wooden platform where signal mirrors and flags were once operated to communicate with distant posts.

features.name: Concealed Equipment Cache
features.description: A hidden stash of sabotage tools, coded messages, and intelligence materials recently dragged here by Crow's Hand operatives.

features.name: Disturbed Undergrowth
features.description: Fresh signs of activity including footprints, drag marks, and hastily concealed evidence of recent occupation.

features.name: West Tower Bell (SQ001)
features.description: One of three silver bell towers in the communication network. The harmonic crystal has been shattered by Malarok's agents, requiring replacement to restore the tower's function.

locations.name: North Tower Overlook
locations.description: A weathered stone watchtower rises from a cleared hilltop, commanding sweeping views of the trade routes and river valleys below. The ancient structure bears scars of recent violence: broken masonry, scattered tools, and torn rope where saboteurs struck. Morning mist clings to the tower's base while the silent bell frame above sways gently in the breeze, a grim reminder of the communication network's vulnerability. Fresh boot prints and discarded supplies suggest the area may not be as abandoned as it appears.

monsters.name: Bandit
monsters.strategy: Watching the tower for signs of repair attempts. Will attack if discovered or if the party attempts to restore the bell.

lootTable: Missing silver bell clapper (hidden near tower base)
Bandit surveillance notes detailing ranger patrol schedules
Rope and climbing gear left by saboteurs
Small cache of rations and silver coins
plotHooks: The missing bell clapper is hidden in the undergrowth near the tower base
Bandit surveillance notes reveal insider knowledge of ranger operations
Evidence of coordinated sabotage suggests this was part of Malarok's larger plan
The tower's strategic position could serve as an early warning post once restored
locations.dmInstructions: Two bandits are stationed here to prevent repairs and watch for ranger activity. They have Perception +1 and will spot approaching parties on a roll of 12+ unless stealth is used. If the party searches the area thoroughly (Investigation DC 12), they find the missing clapper hidden among the rubble. The bandits will flee if reduced to half health, preferring to report back to their superiors rather than fight to the death.
dcChecks: Investigation DC 12: Find the missing silver bell clapper hidden in the undergrowth near the tower base
Perception DC 13: Notice the two bandits watching from concealed positions before they spot the party
Investigation DC 10: Discover evidence of the sabotage including cut ropes and deliberate damage to the bell mechanism
Survival DC 11: Track the bandits' movement patterns and identify their escape routes
locations.accessibility: Elevated position accessible via winding stone path from Trader's Rest, clear sight lines in all directions

features.name: Ancient Watchtower
features.description: A sturdy stone tower with a damaged bell frame at the top. The structure shows signs of recent sabotage with cut ropes and broken mechanisms.

features.name: Scenic Overlook
features.description: The elevated position provides commanding views of trade routes, river valleys, and the Rangers' Outpost below.

features.name: Sabotage Evidence
features.description: Scattered tools, cut ropes, and fresh damage to the bell mechanism reveal the methodical nature of the attack.

features.name: Hidden Bell Clapper
features.description: The missing silver bell clapper lies concealed in the undergrowth near the tower base, discarded by the saboteurs.

features.name: Bandit Surveillance Post
features.description: Concealed positions among the rocks and brush where bandits maintain watch over the tower and surrounding area.
